result.execSummary:
The defendant Frederick Thomas Gurtner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Frederick Thomas Gurtner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Frederick Thomas Gurtner was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED/STAYED
-Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
-Court notes 28 days credit against ultimate sentence.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Defendant subject to regular and random testing.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Participate in any other programming i.e., cognitive intervention.
-Parenting Program.
-Mental Health Assessment if Agent feels necessary.
-Maintain employment.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Joel Kenneth Larimore   DF:  Frederick Thomas Gurtner appeared. Set for final pre-trial. Case called at 4:36 p.m. Plea questionnaire filed. ADA Hahn informs Crt of agreement to plea to Count 1. DE pleads guilty to Count 1 with repeater. DE sworn. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily, and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis, and finds DE guilty of Count 1 with repeater. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Count 2. Crt orders PSI. State Exhibit 1 - O/R. Crt sets for sentencing. Bond continues in form and amount. Adjourned at 5:01 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
